definition: to look/to have a glimpse at/to observe (sth's splendor)
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: April and Corinnehad been gone from home for some time, so I had no way of knowing what they looked like.
sentences.chinese: 阿普里爾和科琳已離家多時，我無緣一睹她們的芳容。

sentences.english: People huddled around the theatre in order to have a look at her beauty.
sentences.chinese: 人們聚集在劇場的周圍，以便一睹她的芳容。

sentences.english: Several thousand supporters strained to catch a glimpse of the new president.
sentences.chinese: 幾千名支持者翹首企盼能一睹新總統的風采。

sentences.english: On the day of the big event, many people came to Big Bend Mountain to watch.
sentences.chinese: 比賽那天，許多人來到大彎山一睹賽況。
我們趕快去一睹爲快吧。

sentences.english: The plotline gives global audiences a chance to see American troops get killed.
sentences.chinese: 情節主線使得全球觀衆有機會一睹美國軍隊被殺。

sentences.english: Here's your chance to check out a traditional Taiwanese market.
sentences.chinese: 在這裏，你可以一睹臺灣傳統市場的風采。

sentences.english: Fans packed the hall to see the band.
sentences.chinese: 樂迷爲了一睹樂隊丰采，把大廳擠得水泄不通。

sentences.english: Each time, the world was eager to see how nearly perfect she had become.
sentences.chinese: 每一次，整個世界都渴望一睹她幾近完美的芳容。

sentences.english: Welcome to the credit score of the future.
sentences.chinese: 現在，就容筆者帶您一睹未來網絡信用評分的真容吧。

sentences.english: Otherwise, be prepared for yet another visit to the panda bears at the National Zoo.
sentences.chinese: 此外，準備好再到國家動物園“一睹熊貓風采”吧。

sentences.english: Now, let's catch a glimpse of these hot and fabulous women.
sentences.chinese: 下面我們就來一睹這些性感尤物的風采吧。

sentences.english: Today, let's look the photos first.
sentences.chinese: 今天，先讓大家一睹爲快。

sentences.english: But what we've never been able to do is stand completely outside the Milky Way and look back at it.
sentences.chinese: 不過，我們至今還無法從銀河系之外一睹它的芳容。

sentences.english: The people throng to see the king .
sentences.chinese: 人們蜂擁着前去一睹國王的雄姿。

sentences.english: Climbing up crags to get a view of islands.
sentences.chinese: 攀上高巖峭壁一睹風光無限的海島。

definition: to have a taste of/to realize/to appreciate
joy of first experience (idiom)/the pleasure of reading sth for the first time
to hold one's breath (in anticipation) (idiom)/to anxiously await
to get close to/to get on intimate terms with
to witness/to see at first hand/to see with one's own eyes
a treat for the eyes/the rare chance of seeing sth beautiful
to explore a mystery/to probe the unknown
to look at sth with pleasure/to watch (sth marvelous)/ornamental
